title: Thai Fried Rice with Pineapple and Chicken

Ingredients.3: 4 ounces chicken breast, cut into small cubes

Ingredients.5: 1 teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed (Optional)

Ingredients.8: 1  red Thai bird chile pepper, finely chopped

Ingredients.13: 4 ounces tiger prawns, peeled and deveined

Directions.1: Place bacon in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat; cook and stir until crisp, about 10 minutes. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon onto a paper towel-lined plate; set aside. Reserve bacon drippings in the wok.

Directions.2: Cook and stir shallots in bacon drippings over medium-high heat until fragrant and light brown, 1 to 2 minutes.

Directions.3: Stir chicken into shallots and cook, without stirring, until browned on one side, 45 seconds to 1 minute; stir. Continue cooking until chicken is browned, about 1 minute. Add 2 teaspoons curry powder; stir until chicken is coated.

Directions.4: Make a well in the center of chicken and pour oil into the center of the well; add egg yolks. Cook and stir egg yolks until set, 1 to 2 minutes. Add rice and stir, breaking up rice.

Directions.5: Mix chile pepper, cilantro, soy sauce, remaining 2 teaspoons curry powder, fish sauce, and sugar into rice mixture; add shrimp and cook until shrimp is cooked through and pink, about 2 minutes. Fold pineapple, green onions, and bacon into rice mixture.
